word_mean: 〔有〕意识，清醒：为一种有意识、清醒、完全有知觉、有判断力的状态
“意识障碍”指注意力和感知力紊乱，其中包括“意识模糊”，如精神错乱、谵妄。“意识水平”是指临床上不同的清醒程度，包括清醒、可被唤醒、昏睡、感觉迟钝、木僵和昏迷

sentence.Network_en: There was very little snobbery or class-consciousness in the wartime navy.
sentence.Network_cn: 战时的海军中很少有势利眼，阶级意识也不强。

sentence.Network_en: That idea has been creeping into our consciousness for some time.
sentence.Network_cn: 不知不觉间，那种想法在我们脑海里渐渐形成已经有一段时间了。

sentence.Network_en: I was meditating, and reached a higher state of consciousness.
sentence.Network_cn: 我在冥想，并进入了一个更高的意识境界。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 意识（consciousness），是指人所特有的反映现实的最高形式，是人对现实的一种有意识、有组织的反映，也可以说意识就是人的心 …
知_百度百科 ... 1. 知识[ knowledge] 3. 知觉[ consciousness] 4. 知己[ bosom friend].
自考英语二词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... synthesis n. 结合，合成 consciousness n. 意识，知觉；觉悟 instrument n. 仪器；乐器.
背单词的技巧_百度知道 ... compose  组成，构成；创作 consciousness  意识，觉悟，自觉 conscience  良心，良知.

list.abs: 一、民族意识的界定民族意识(national consciousness)是一个内涵和外延都很丰富的概念。恩格斯(1844)首先提出“民族意识”一词,但没有给出明确的定义。我国最早给.
心理学专业词汇翻译辞典 - MBA智库文档 ... legal authority 法定权威 legal consciousness 法律意识 legal guarantee 法律保证.
四、集体意识（collective consciousness）的外在世界，有共同价值与形式的文化世界。 人格中最深、最不易碰触到得层次。
名著《宇宙意识》 (Cosmic consciousness)的作者——心理师理查德•巴克认为，光的幻象是一个经验是否属于宇宙性的最重要基准。 …

entry.def: Your consciousness is your mind and your thoughts.

example.ex: That idea has been creeping into our consciousness for some time.
example.tran: 不知不觉间，那种想法在我们脑海里渐渐形成已经有一段时间了。

entry.def: The consciousness of a group of people is their set of ideas, attitudes, and beliefs.

example.ex: The Greens were the catalysts of a necessary change in the European consciousness.
example.tran: 绿党促使欧洲人的观念发生了必要的改变。

entry.tran: (对特定主题或观点的)关注，意识
entry.def: You use consciousness to refer to an interest in and knowledge of a particular subject or idea.

example.ex: Her political consciousness sprang from  her upbringing when her father's illness left the family short of money.
example.tran: 她的政治意识源于她的成长经历，那时因为父亲生病，家境窘迫。

entry.def: Consciousness is the state of being awake rather than being asleep or unconscious. If someone loses consciousness, they become unconscious, and if they regain consciousness, they become conscious after being unconscious.

example.ex: She banged her head and lost consciousness...
example.tran: 她撞到了头，失去了知觉。

example.ex: He drifted in and out of consciousness.

means.word_mean: 1. an alert cognitive state in which you are aware of yourself and your situation;

sentences.sentence: "he had no awareness of his mistakes"
"his sudden consciousness of the problem he faced"
"their intelligence and general knowingness was impressive"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,"性质,状态",通常加在形容词后面

busi+ness性质,状态→n.商业,买卖,交易,生意
careful小心的,仔细的+ness性质,状态→n.仔细,慎重
clean清洁+li+ness性质,状态→cleanliness洁癖,清洁

dark黑暗+ness性质,状态→n.黑暗,阴暗,秘密
